cons: In a large organization it can sometimes feel that changes happen slowly, but decisions are made very methodically and with a lot of forethought.

review_title: Human resouces do not assist in helping staff with any discriminating issues
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: They pay very well, have many variety of flexible shifts and fields of specialty. However, if you're ever a victim of discrimination or  harassment prepare yourself to hire a GREAT employment attorney.
cons: Many department follow the policies, rules and regulations. Most of the managers follow the EEOC regulations and teat all of their employees equal.

pros: Every employee works together when times get busy. From the environmental service employees, to security, to the nurses and doctors, NO ONE feels more important than the other and the team work is great. All technology in the ER is up-to-date and the nurse to patient ratio is 1 to 3, and if there is a critical patient, the load is lessened.
cons: My personal con is having to wait 2 years to get benefits of student loan help.

pros: All the staff really works together so well and your unit truly begins to feel like a family. The education department is great and the hospital really helps to make sure their staff is well educated on new updates and processes. Additionally, the hospital has new renovations making it that much nicer and improving on the quality of care patients can receive.
cons: The current charting system is very out of date and paper charting is also used which can be a major challenge when it comes to trying to ensure patients receive the best care. Additionally, there tends to be some disorganization when it comes to new hires and creating new schedules, but eventually evens out.

review_title: Work Environment is Second to None!
pros: Northside Hospital Cherokee is committed to caring for all patients like family. This is certainly the theme of the culture of this workplace. The positive support from Senior Leadership, the camaraderie of front line staff are unparalleled in any other organization. You will find great support for nursing, with reduced ratios to promote the connection to your patients. There is excellent support and we are truly able to provide the best care for our patients. You will receive much appreciation as a team member in this hospital. It is also exciting to be working for a place with such significant growth in the community.
cons: None to report. Great place to work!

pros: The pay and benefits were tolerable. I enjoyed my co-workers.
cons: The managent at this company is out of touch with how the employees feel and they simply don't care. They havery the largest turn over rate that I have seen in acute care. I have worked at many hospitals and this is the worst. I worked in a department that traditionally doesnt have a turn over, but because they were so mismanagemedon't and concerned only with profit, it was just ridiculous the turn over rate, due to the amount of work we had to do. The average stay for employees went from retiring to one year or less for employment.

review_title: A year in the life of Northside
pros: Continuous technology development. Opportunity for growth. My opinions matter and are heard.
cons: Particularly to my department, I feel that changes being rolled out are very unorganized. It is hard to motivate your staff when I myself feel overwhelmed with how the processes are being carried out and all we get is “I’m sorry it’s last minute”, that to me is unacceptable. Certain decisions are not thoroughly thought out and planned for being carried out efficiently.

pros:
- Work/Life Balance
- Flexibility in schedule
- Amazing team setting
- Great work environment
- Team Building
- Understanding leadership

Northside is the best organization I have ever worked for. My leaders are very understanding and flexible. I enjoy my colleagues and the work that I do. I have worked for other hospitals in the Atlanta area and nothing compares to the experience I have had with this organization.
cons: Parking and traffic around the Atlanta campus can get hectic, but they are working on fixing the parking issue now.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Caring supportive Management.  Team Mates are always willing to help each other. A lot of learning opportunities; especially NICU.  Schedule Flexability.  Majority of the staff work diligently toward giving Quality patient care.
cons: Understaffed with high turnover. Outdated EMR and charting process.  No continuity of care: daily assignment switched often.  A lot of medical waste.  Processes are disorganized, time consuming and less productive.

review_title: I love this organization! I had to come back.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Lawrenceville, GA
pros:
At Northside, there is a huge effort put forth to keep moral high.  
This is my second time working for this organization. I left after two years to obtain a job position closer to home. However, working for Northside is definitely worth the drive!
The recruiting / hiring process is awesome. Done mostly electronically, it makes the transition into a new position very easy.
cons: I honestly can’t think of any cons.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Canton, GA
pros: Northside is a great company to work for.  They really invest in the growth and development of their employees.  They offer many educational opportunities and listens to what the nurses on the front line say.  They want everyone to reach their highest potential.  They focus on patient safety and satisfaction without sacrificing quality of care. They have a strong shared governance and leadership really listens. Great Company to work for.  Great benefits
cons: They can take a long time to approve positions needed by the floor.

review_title: Good place to work with many different locations to choose from.
pros: Pension after 5 years of employment
cons:
Must take PTO for Northside holidays (7 days) on days when facility is closed which decreases PTO by 7 Days/yr.

Not allowed to work four 10 hour shifts but must work five 8/hr shifts. Most Dr offices have similar daytime hours, therefore, I must use PTO to go to various Dr appointments: including yearly exams. Some managers do not want to give the time off.

review_title: After years of a workplace that treated me well, those who did so were eliminated and the culture changed immensely.
job_title: Clinical Case Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: Competitive pay and benefits package.
cons: Those who were willing to be yes men and women were promoted while those who tried to help enhance practices were gagged or fired.  Unstable and abusive management styles made workers  feel they could do no right and jobs were at risk.  Very little praise was given for a job well done even when it was being done with minimal supervision and resources.

pros:
Provides decent healthcare for community.
Provides employment opportunities for various disciplines.
cons:
Talent Acquisition sub par, too many cooks in kitchen, hiring process unorganized with conflicting follow up for internal transfers and new hires.
Employee Relations sub par, department not functioning as typical large healthcare organization ER department should.
EEO/AA discrimination exists at all campuses to high degree obstructing qualified applicants from being hired, current staff from chances at deserved promotions and/or transfers, and encouraging terminations for minorities while others receive no reprimand for the same or more serious mistakes or violations.

pros: Great benefits/ Great Pay/ Work life balanced
cons: Messy Supervisors/ Poor open door policy

pros: Pension plan and matched 403b.  In my department no holidays, nights, or weekends. Physicians and physicians assistants are great to work with.
cons:
No autonomy.  Micromanaged beyond belief.  Short staffed. High staff turn over.
No support from management.  Reprimanded for thinking outside the box, for being an independent thinker, or not following the "status quo".

pros: This company is growing faster than any there hospital in the Atlanta area. Because of our size, we are spoiled with competitive benefits and perks, flexibility at work, opportunities to volunteer and be involved in the community. My favorite part of working here is that NSH strives to make ME feel important and feel like I'm part of a successful company.
cons: Due to the fast growth of the company, sometimes it can be stressful keeping up specially in the depts that are directly impacted

job_title: RN, Clinical Supervisor in Atlanta, GA
pros: Competitive pay and benefits, as well as pension program, focus on teamwork, room for growth, great nurse-patient ratios, constant opportunities for education
cons: At the Atlanta campus (I can't speak for the other campuses), we have a lot of new grad nurses, which in many ways is wonderful. New grads are typically  enthusiastic and energetic, and usually eager to learn. However, in many patient care departments, we are lacking in experienced nurses. I don't think this is an issue specific to Northside, but I do see the effects of it here.

review_title: It used to be great. New management  is dragging it down.
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Canton, GA
pros: The hospital and employees are great. They really provide great care and service.
cons: This is specifically about the Cherokee location. The new management  is awful and does not care about it's employees or resolving any issues. They don't want to work on fixing issues. The manager flat out said in a staff meeting..If you are not happy then leave, instead of trying to come up with a solution.  I'm not saying that everyone can be pleased all the time but there should be some communication and trying to solve issues instead of just   take it or leave.

review_title: Northside is more than just a job!
pros: Northside has worked with my diligently with making my hiring process smooth and easy.  All my questions/inquiries get answered and/or settled within 24-48 hours. I am working diligently to pay off my student loans and Northside's competitive pay has helped me reach my halfway point! I would recommend Northside Hospital as a place to work, a place to grow and a wonderful place to continue learning!
cons: I have not had any issues with working for Northside Hospital. I am eager to climb into management and start learning more about leadership and can't wait to be given more opportunities that I know Northside will offer!

review_title: Get more information before accepting a position at this facility
job_title: Former Occupational Therapist in Atlanta, GA
pros: very short commute to work. My supervisor is not a micromanger. the employees are extremely friendly, and a sense of community and people help each other ( at least my department was that way)
cons: No praise when doing a good job. Not flexible with time off. Not enough time off. No sick leave, all vacation is lumped together. We get 24 days per year, this includes holidays, vacation and sick time, so if you get sick you spend your vacation days as sick days.

pros: I have worked for other hospitals and organizations in the area and NSH is one of the best.  What sets it apart from the rest is that no only does the organization say they value the employees, but demonstrate it.  Employees are encouraged to submit ideas and look for ways to improve the organization and the service that we provide to the community.  Because of this employees feel that what they do is important and that what they do matters.
cons: As in most organizations today, there are lots of changes. The organization does a good job in trying to communicate the changes before they are implemented.

review_title: Liked the Colleagues, lacked support from the higher-ups
pros: Definitely loved my coworkers. Young, energetic atmosphere. Nice facilities. Never wanted in supplies or equipment.
cons:
Too much charting (between paper and electronic charts)
Not enough support staff
With NSH being the only hospital in Metro Atlanta taking the most popular, new Obamacare plan, we're having a huge influx of patients and not enough support staff or hours in a day to get everything we need done. 
Lunch breaks are give or take. They should be required.

review_title: Surgical Services-RUN AND DONT LOOK BACK
pros:
Great team of staff nurses.
Majority of the hospital staff are friendly and patients are great
cons:
Incompetent management
Personality and behavioral issues.
Inconsistent with following their own rules.
Very two faced leadership team in this department.
Low pay and little voice if you're a pee on.
Managers block you from moving departments.
Upper management isn't clinical and IT SHOWS!!

pros: Plentiful resources for employees, valuable opportunities to progress within the organization, and open-mind to help advance the organization.
cons: The parking situation is upsetting.  I work hard to make sure I fulfill my duties.  I feel I should be able to park in the area that will alleviate stress that I already have to deal with while being at work.  I am made to park in a lot that is quite a long distance from the floor I work on.  There are times I have gotten to the parking lot SUPER early and I am still late for work because I have to wait on the shuttle.  When I get off work, I would like to be able to walk straight to my car like my other colleagues, instead, I'm made to wait outside on a shuttle to take me back to the dirt lot.  Even if I did not want to wait or if the shuttle was taking too long, it still isn't safe for me to walk to my car during the night time.  Because I am afraid of walking to my car at night, I am forced to wait after a long shift to be taken back to my car. I do not understand why I am not allowed to park in a deck that is actually safer for me to walk in  so that I can get to work.  If I decide to park in the deck, I am made to pay.  That is not fair, especially when I do the best that I can to represent this facility the best I know how.   Having me park in a dirt lot makes me feel as if I am not valued or appreciated within this company.  As hard as I work, the least one could do is allow me to park in a place that will be beneficial to my safety and allow me to get to work on time.  I am not the only one who feels this way; many of my other colleagues who also have been denied access are just as upset as I am.  I've been working for this company for over 6 months now and I still can't park in a place that is more helpful for me.  Because of this, I cannot refer anyone to work for this company knowing they will have to deal with this as well.

pros: Northside Hospital truly cares about their employees. They work hard to make sure their patients are cared for in the most caring and safe way by employing some of the most amazing staff nurses there are. The people who I’ve worked with at Northside are all incredibly passionate about their jobs and they love caring for each patient they encounter.
cons: I currently work at NSC, which is growing at a rapid rate. This is a great thing, but at times as an employee we can feel the growing pains. After some time this will subside and we will be fully staffed with Even more incredible staff

pros: Northside hospital from my perspective has the best interest at heart when it comes to their employees. There are ample opportunities to advance, grow, and enhance your skills within your field. Northside hospital offers many resources for a myriad of things to help their employees succeed within their career here! I honestly have been working here about 3 going on 4 years now and my life has changed for the better! thankful for the opportunity to be apart of the Northside family!!
cons: In my personal opinion I have not had any experiences here to say that there are any cons!

review_title: I am very satisfied with my employment at Northside
pros: The opportunities for advancement are great. The employees are friendly and willing to help others.  Northside as a whole is involved in areas that allows the employees to partake in volunteering in various areas.  They also give quarterly bonuses.
cons: Northside's time off is different from other companies, theirs is PTO (paid time off).  However, it's nothing that they actually give you, you accure the time from time worked.

job_title: MEDICAL CARE PROVIDER in Atlanta, GA
pros: Northside has one of the busiest maternity wards in the country, but manages to still create a pleasant experience for patients, while maintaining the highest levels of safety and patient care. I had my child here because I work here and know how great the care is.
cons: Depends on the position as to how well your position is scheduled. Regular shift schedules are available for some positions, others are on demand or on-call.

pros: The benefits package is nice- no one else has a pension program like theirs and they pay more than another healthcare system in GA that I used to work at.
cons: Management is a joke. Incompetent, non-experienced managers. My manager has even said that she just wants to hire people that won't give her any lip or attitude. She has turned away good qualified employees for ones with zero experience because she likes to have full control.

pros: Benefits are great including insurance, 401k matching, and pension.  Site supervisor  is supportive and consistently does what he can to facilitate my work.  Management and peers within my modality are available and happy to help with any issues or questions. I am grateful to have landed here at my outpatient center and have a smart capable group of coworkers who care about their patients and the work they do. Fantastic work environment.
cons: PRN coverage can be difficult to find, but this far my supervisor has protected my right for work life balance and gives me time off when I need it.

pros: Northside Hospital is very adept at focusing on the little opportunities for improvement. This extends from extends down from Administration to the front line service teams. By focusing on the little opportunities, Northside Hospital has been able to cultivate an almost grassroots culture which encourages and promotes a healthcare worker's ability to provide exceptionally empathetic and compassionate care to our communities.
cons: Northside is a conservative company. There are not many downsides, however, there is a high level of due diligence performed when process changes take place and sometimes things do not move very fast.

job_title: Account Support Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great place to work awesome benefits and longevity. Northside Hospital has the latest technology and most of the Doctors make TOP DOC Magazine.
cons: I would love to see people of all backgrounds in leadership roles. I think more diverse we can be the better we can understand and see life different outside of our own eyes

pros: Although Northside is a large organization and healthcare system, I have never felt isolated as an employee. My direct supervisor and senior leadership have always made me feel valued and supported. The culture at Northside is patient first, and each department works collaboratively to maintain that as a central focus to each project and task. I have enjoyed my time at Northside so far!
cons: I truly don't have any cons in regards to Northside as an employer. Keeping a positive attitude and working well with others is the recipe for success at Northside!

job_title: Denial Management Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Northside Hospital is my dream job come true. I love the diversity at Northside Hospital. Regardless of race, gender or ethnicity, management and leadership are diversified. There is room for advancement and employees are abled to transferred to other departments. Specific job training is thorough and management is very hands on to assist with the success of their department and or team. Northside hospital rewards with monthly bonuses when cash goals are exceeded. No other hospital offers the type of bonuses rewarded to Northside Hospital employees. The perks are awesome. It's an advantage to be a Northside employee.
cons: No late shift passed 7:45am

pros: The turnover rate is so high which makes it easy to move around within the company. A good place for new grad nurses to get initial experience
cons: Management doesn't support the staff against patients. The patient is right no matter what. They want you to treat the patients like royalty, yet the staff are treated like crap. They are still using paper charting and the equipment is NOT on the cutting edge. The retention rate is very high because management doesn't address any of the staff concerns.

pros: I've gained a lot of experience from fellow co-workers. The majority of my coworkers are very nice and helpful.
cons: There really isn't anyone following up on ensuring that everyone gets trained properly. I haven't had anyone check up on me or tell me if I'm doing a good job or if there are areas that I should improve on.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Atlanta, GA
pros: Working together to provide our patients the best outcome can be difficult in an Emergency situation but at NS-A we understand that we can’t do it alone!  The understanding and trust of having great colleagues makes this department great!
cons: The hospital has grown and the lay out and finding your way around and through the hospital and parking for employees could improve.

job_title: New Grad RN in Canton, GA
pros: Every step of the process has been positive. The recruiter was fabulous and the interview was wonderful. They all made me feel extremely welcome and the questions were standard and thought provoking, creating more of a conversation. I was notified quickly of my offer of employment. They kept me well informed every step of the way.  Everyone I met has been extremely helpful and friendly. The benefits are great and the  pay was very competitive as well.
cons: I haven’t  found any cons yet.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Atlanta, GA
pros: Staff and management are very personable and professional also let’s not forget knowledgeable. The pay is great, benefits are amazing, work space is clean and neat, call center environment. Laid back unless on the phones. Training is smooth and at your own paste while following along. The trainer is very thorough.Coworkers were VERY up front about telling me how simple the job can be by learning and mastering the basics. Work schedule is perfect.
cons: Training was virtual due to Covid 19..HOWEVER...(The trainer was READILY accessible via phone and or zoom conference call to answers questions at any given moment )(PRO)

review_title: Great long term company with good benefits
pros: Once you get hired you are solid with their IT department. You really have to go out of your way tto get fired.
cons: There is a reason turnover rate is so high. Employees are not valued once hired. Opinions should be the same as management. Outside the box thinking is not encouraged. Nepotism runs rampant. Most if not all promotions are hired outside and rarely promotions are done within unless you're a buddy or family member.Get all you can during hiring process because you will be stuck at that pay with minor increases for the remainder. Very kneejerk reactive to most issues. Very little of the planning ahead of time for projects gets implemented because the communication is limited. This is a very silo'd workplace. THe left hand has absolutely no clue what the right hand is doing wasting lots of man hours and money. This is an efficiency experts "Wet Dream". Lots of money to be made by evaluating and refining basic implementations. There is very little that will change because all upper level management are buddies. Micromanagment is comical. Several people telling you different ways to do something they dont fully understand themselves. The expectation is "You should know what to do because.....well because you should just know". This makes for a very arrogant and ignorant workplace. This is not a good combination. I think this is still a great place to work with all the cons because there are a lot of really great intelligent people trying to make a difference. They are just being held at bay by people in the wrong position with not enough knowldege, and a fear someone might make them look bad.

job_title: Environmental Specialist in Sandy Springs, Fulton, GA
pros: The staff at Northside hospital makes you want to be apart of the team during my interview I said I can see my myself working for this wonderful company I'm very excited to be a part of Northside team and they never gave up on me during my interview process and was very patient so now I am ready to pursue my career thanks Northside, and proud to have a 401k at my age.
cons: No down side I love the hospital environment nothing but friendly smile all day.

job_title: RN Team Leader in Canton, GA

Northside is committed to providing excellent patient care in a holistic caring environment. Northside believes in their employees and in turn the employees believe in Northside!
cons: We need to recruit more nurses!

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Atlanta, GA

pros: I always say hello to every employee and volunteer. 99% of the time every one of them will greet back and it gives the work place an inviting atmosphere. I enjoy working at Northside (FCC) because I am treated like family and staff members communicate with each other respectfully. I appreciate everything that the Nurses and Tech’s do for me and they appreciate what I do for them. Also, the benefits at Northside is great. Not a lot of companies provide a Pension plan.

pros: Great management team, well organized hospital, yearly merit raise, and great opportunity for promotion.  Northside Hospital invests and truly cares about their employees.  Northside Hospital has great benefits and very competitive salary.  Great working condition for nurses compares to other hospitals.  Great culture of Service Excellence.
cons: I've been working at Northside Hospital for more than 10 years.  I have not seen any negative things I can say about this organization.  It is a very well run hospital.  I'm very proud to be a part of this organization for more than 10 years.

review_title: The place to work and be!
pros: Northside Hospital is the place to work and be! If you are looking to work somewhere where you are appreciated, valued, and a place you will truly enjoy being employed at, Northside is the place for you! All the employees are always smiling, working as a team, and are always so kind! I LOVE working at Northside. The pay is amazing, the benefits you can’t beat, and the team I work with in the Pharmacy is phenomenal! I truly enjoy my job. Northside is the way to go!
cons: There are no cons with Northside Hospital.

job_title: Patient Access Supervisor in Cumming, GA

cons: Work/Life balance can suffer due to being  consistently understaffed because the hiring and training process is so slow and difficult. Top down management in can occasionally be an issue, but not a major one.

review_title: Good place to start for hospital experience.
job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Supervisors are very helpful. Good place to start to gain hospital experience. Coworkers work as a team especially when training people that are new.

The uniforms are thought to be professional but actually aren’t this being taken from comments made by patients. I often mistaken as a Kroger employee when grocery shopping after work.

review_title: So PROUD to work at Northside
pros: Family Culture, Empowered by Leadership, Stability, Loyalty, Pension, the PEOPLE! I can honestly say that my team at work is like family to me. This year has been so challenging on everyone across the United States but I can' imagine facing these healthcare mountains with any other team. The people at Northside always pull together to get the job done no matter how large the task.
cons: Wish we had the ability to get the whole organization together more!

pros: Best Women's Services in the South.  Oppurtunities to grow and advance..FMLA, short term disability, long term disability, 401 K

review_title: I  feel  pride over the campus by the patient's and staff that we are at the right place , receiving the best care .
job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Atlanta, GA
pros: The hours, the locations, and the reputation of the hospital makes me proud to be apart of such an exceptional team.
cons: The only CON I can think of would be of course the traffic to get here.  I guess we are so popular everybody's trying to get here!!!

job_title: RN, Bsn in Northside Park, GA

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant & Scheduler Unit Secretary in Macon, GA

review_title: Love the company, Most are very welcoming!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Forsyth, GA

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in North Atlanta, GA
pros: Some hospitals are good in the clinical setting but not on the business side, and vice versa--and if one side falls behind, the other will eventually struggle as well.  Northside excels at both, with forward thinking management and plenty of room for both the company and its employees to grow.
cons: The only downside of working at Northside is the traffic on the north perimeter.  But then that's just Atlanta.  My management has let me adjust my working hours to avoid much of the traffic problems, so it's not much of a complaint.

review_title: More than a place to work!
pros: Working at Northside Hospital feels like working with family (that you like).  As with any family, there are ups and down but in the end, we are all working for a greater good.  Employees are committed to their roles and many are active in the community.
cons: Although it feels like a small company, Northside Hospital is a LARGE company.  It can sometimes be a challenge to find who you need to assist with a question or issue. Change also does NOT happen very fast; changes are thoroughly reviewed before implementation.

review_title: I love the culture at Northside hospital
job_title: Supply Chain Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great people to work with, there’s nothing like building not only professional relationships but also friendships, and being able to come to work and be happy about helping patients and departments and seeing all the lovely people and being able to brighten someone’s day !
cons: I honestly can’t think of anything that’s negative, I haven’t found one yet

review_title: Northside Cherokee: It sucks, but it's not the worst place I've worked.
pros: Day shift gets a lot of freebies from the company. For example, king of pops and pizza. There's also cookouts from time to time and the managers serve you good food. The cafeteria has a large selection of foods.
cons: Oh boy. Unsafe patient ratios (1:10). Promises from management that aren't kept ( We won't give you an admission after 6:30; patient comes up symptomatic and with hypertension at 6:55). Hard to take a vacation, but the managers take vacation every other week (No joke). Strict call out policy (work until you die). You don't get a lunch break, and they don't really care. But you'll get in trouble if you don't and won't get paid the extra money for missed 30 minute lunch. Some charge nurses will go into the office and you won't see them the rest of the night. Some will go out to smoke every 30 minutes with the secretary  and then go straight into a patients room smelling like an ashtray (I work with an at risk population by the way, so I wish I was exaggerating here). None of computers work half the time, the dynamaps work sometimes if it's your lucky day. Other floors have more favoritism and there's a clear managerial preference over our floor, and they bully us to take more admissions when we're already full so that they can be free for the rest of the night. So we don't have the supplies we need or the support we need in order to provide safe patient care. There's also a lack of diversity hospital wide and racism from coworkers that is unadressed by superiors. New nurses are teaching new nurses so things are also being missed. In my contract, I was told that I was not allowed to precept until I had been working for one year. About two months out of the residency, I was given a preceptee and was told that I wouldn't even be paid for it; not even later when I am qualified by policy to accept a resident. I was told, " Everyone does it, so I need to too". People are leaving left and right, and the inability to keep staff on the unit will affect your evaluation and your raise. So you might never get a raise because management can't keep their staff; and the manager has even stated that she doesn't even care about that.  When you are on RAD (requested leave if the census is low), you can be called in at 5:30; even if you live an hour away to be there for 30 minutes to an hour. If you accidentally forget you're working that day, which is very possible because they change the schedule all the time, they will say that you can be fired without even calling you first to make sure if there was a mistake. Make sure you have a friend that can text or call you to have your back. I don't really see any advancement in my career here either. Pay doesn't match the current market for nurses.

review_title: Can be an excellent place to work but...
pros: Our Manager and supervisor will come out of an office or a meeting just to help when things get overwhelming
cons: Not all but a large number of Nurses (RNs) who aren't managers are supervisors feel they are above patient care. They will do things like call a tech to do something that takes maybe 3 secs while the tech is assisting another patient. They will make that patient wait for the tech becWhile the nurse is sitting in a stairwell or locker room scrolling thier call phone, they feel they are above actual Patient Care, which affect the patients wait time. When the Tech can get there the patient is annoyed simply because they asked for coffee while the Tech was assisting a patient with personal care.  I appluade all the Nurses who sincerely work with the Techs as a team but for the ones who dont, know everyones job would be a little easier if only you did get that coffee or help get a patient dressed to go home while your tech is actually doing patient care with someone else. Sadly we will lose a lot of good hard working people because Nurses have forgotten what their First Semester of school taught them PATIENT Care, Bedside manner,  even some Doctors will even assist  and that really bothers me I wont sign up for a job I wont put my all into.  In the mean time RNs will and have spoken disrespectfully to the support staff with no regard they are speaking to an adult. The Nurse dont respect a lunch break unless it's there own. I've been called back from lunch after 15mins because a nurse felt she was above a discharge.  I've had a nurse make a patient wait until I've returned from a discharge just to toilet a patient. When she finally did assit the patient with the bedpan she spilled urine in the patients bed and had me clean it up after me return to the floor. I was gone almost 20mins. I know I wouldnt want to be left in urine for 20 mins just because my nurse didnt want to clean up a mess she created. I would make sure the patient was comfortable and at ease until the person can get back to help the patient .

pros: Plenty of room for growth. Going through restructuring to step up their game in Atlanta's healthcare market. Cancer center is huge and they are in need of some great workers.
cons: Difficult to enter the organization... you have to know someone. HR is not the best at staying in contact. They are trying to expand their educational clinical side.

pros:
This is an organization on the move and is experiencing tremendous growth and striving for best practice.  The staff is committed to best care for our patients.  The immediate leadership team is dedicated to the staff.
The organization has provided for equipment and tools I need to do my job and more.    They are supportive in continuing education efforts for professionals.
cons: Transparency about organizational and departmental  growth and issues is sometimes lacking.  High level executives are not seen or heard.

pros: Supervisor, 2nd shift in Radiology was great. Benefits seemed good but was let go before that came into effect. I was out of the field for a while but supervisor was patient with me even though I made vast improvements prior to being let go.  I suppose it just wasn't fast enough for them. Orientation was okay but only because was given compensation for the time. Most of people met during work were great, and greeted in hallways. Most of the co-workers were friendly but some weren't so much.
cons: Folder was required for the vast amount of paperwork for new hires, severely bureaucratic.  Some things will be shown and checked off on the first day or two but will only really come in time. Letter for position jeopardy was given but I believe they already had made up their mind. I think I was great with patients and made vast improvements since that wake-up call. Gave me some b.s. about can't teach energy, etc prior to being fired, it was just added things to justify firing me. Most of the co-workers were great but some not so much. Most of the better co-workers were temporary travel techs. I believe their own skills check-off was what held me back. I was ready to do scans and was not allowed to do so, some was my fault but these check-offs were the simplest things. Badge given didn't work for the 6 weeks I was there in at least 3 commonly used doors, Supervisor tried to remedy that but was ineffective. If it doesn't work you seem to be SOL for a while. Even though a letter of position jeopardy was given, the next meeting was sudden and was clocked out immediately and shown to the door, was not even allowed to finish the day so not much job security. Was planning to finish the majority of the first set of check-offs that week but didn't matter.

pros: I came to work at NSH about 9 years and it has been one of the best places that I have worked.  The nurse-patient staff ratios are great (even on nights) and there is always someone around to help since the charge nurse does not take patients.  There is also plenty of room for growth!! Great place for nurses!!
cons: I don't like the fact that NSH does not MANDATE  that everyone (all doctors) use the  computer documentation system, that causes a lot of confusion.

review_title: Northside is a great place to work
pros: Northside is a great place to work.  The atmosphere is friendly and the employees are professional and courteous to each other and to our patients.  I feel like everyone here truly cares about their patients and works together to give them the best care possible.
cons: I have to drive an hour to get to work, but that is the only downside of working here.  I like it so much that I drive right by another large hospital halfway to work and have not even considered applying there.

review_title: Warm Welcome and Safe Work Environment
pros: Northside has provided such a safe and seamless way to provide great care. They eliminate unnecessary miscommunications and really streamline efficiency and safety for patients. They are always thinking of patient experience and the management truly cares for it's staff.
cons: Over the course of the onboarding process, it has been a bit tricky to finish each task as more than one representative has asked for forms to be filled, etc. at random times. Other than that, they haven't made it difficult, just lots of communication with different people at short notice.

pros:
I was hired full time a year ago. However, I needed to go PRN due to a  family emergency. My lab manager was so understanding and assist me with my job status change.  When I was ready to return full time I contact my original HR recruiter And not only did she assist me with coming back full time she help me transfer to another location. After, I was there for a month she checked on me. 
I'm happy to be a Northside Employee!
cons: I have none as of yet

pros: pto hours, pension plan, insurance,
cons: covid relatied: allow more employees to work from home if their job can successfully be done from home. I come into work everyday but I do not interact with patients. I did interact with patients before covid but we have been instructed to have no more face to face with patients until further notice. my work is based on my computer and phone calls now but i am still putting myself at risk coming into work everyday but locking myself in an office to limit interactions with co workers.

review_title: Hired safely and efficiently during a Pandemic!
job_title: Transplant Financial Resource Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros: The hiring process was long but that was only because of the restrictions due to COVID. The HR representative kept me notified of every step of the process even during times that we were in waiting due to the pandemic. I completed my interview virtually as well as orientation and they both were thorough. I have been please working for Northside over the past 2 months. Benefits, incentives and overall employee satisfaction has made my transition to Atlanta and a new hospital system easy!
cons: No cons at this time

review_title: Need to improve benifits for better staff retention
pros: Resources are available to provide great care. The focus is always on exceptional care. Policies and procedures in place to guide staff and overall a good atmosphere between nurses and physicians.
cons: Better and more attractive compensation would help with staff retention. Management can show more appreciation for staff. Absolutely no autonomy.

review_title: Great People. Great Company. Great Benefits.
job_title: Clinical Nurse Specialist in Atlanta, GA
pros: I have worked in a nursing leadership position at Northside for several years. The nurses here are the BEST and Northside offers more nursing support and development programs than any of the other organizations I have worked in - which include multiple hospitals in the Atlanta metro area. Great work / life balance and a true commitment to quality improvement.
cons: No organizational cons. Traffic can be tough around Sandy Springs location - which is just part of life in Atlanta. The drive is worth it to work at Northside.

review_title: Management was horrible. Management was not experienced or professional. They were continuously battling with each other
job_title: Front Office Assistant in Lawrenceville, GA
pros: Once you've past all the hospital quality test. It's smooth sailing because they really don't have the staffing to support the system and their policies.
cons: To many small specialty groups have been acquired by this company and they don't have the skills or qualified staff to manage.

job_title: Physician Denials Management in Atlanta, GA
pros: Staff is amazing, pay is great,  traffic to get to work is sometime crazy but worth the commute.  Management listens to you,  work is always being appreciated, acknowledged, I am very glad to be part of Northside Hospital.  It has become a second home to me- It had just been a year for me for working for Northside, but feels like I have been working for Northside for the longest time.
cons: None -  I do not think anything that I would have issues of-

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Canton, GA
pros: Decent at working with scheduling, 12 hour shifts mean you can get FT hours in 3 days which you'll need for your second job
cons: Techs are paid around the same as Walmart cart pushers in spite of having by far the most patient care interaction of anyone in the hospital. Techs are not offered same incentives to work extra as nurses, no hip, double hip or hot shifts. Just be happy you have a job, I suppose?

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Lots of opportunity for overtime. Great co-workers and teamwork. If you like a fast paced environment, this will be a good fit. Also lots of opportunity for career advancement or transferring to different departments/units.
cons: Management is out of touch with how to make employees happy and want to stay. Pay scale is an insult. Work understaffed with a higher than agreed upon patient load.

pros: The staff are committed to providing the best care for the patient.  Northside works to be a functional part of the community and places patient care as it’s primary focus.  You will find an underlying drive to retain employees and support to reach your goals.
cons: Just like any large corporation occasionally you may have to work through some minor bureaucracy.   However, I have found that when management becomes aware they will immediately do what they can to fix the barrier and support the employee.

job_title: Talent Acquisition Recruiter in Atlanta, GA
pros: I was hired by Northside a few months ago and have really enjoyed my time here so far. The leadership staff, and the HR department where i work, has been very supportive, especially regarding the pandemic. The hospital has been very busy for the past few months, but despite this, I have always felt supported as a new hire. Northside is a company that cares truly about its employees, and one that I am proud to work for.
cons: None that I have run into so far!

job_title: Coding Operations Manager in Atlanta, GA
pros: Pay and benefits were great!  Large facility with well respected physicians
cons: Hard to present ideas to management or others without being seen as incomptent if ideas were not well received.  Very difficult to work with offsite contract coding especially with quality issues.   A lot of pressure to have quality work when it was mostly out of the job's realm to enforce.

pros: Salaries are competitive. The benefits are good. Pension is a plus but PTO is mediocre. Community discounts are decent.
cons: Terrible EMR, out dated equipment. Has outgrown its facilities and is not expanding in Atlanta and it desperately needs to. Heavy on middle management. NEVER see upper management.

review_title: A great Job,A great Place to work.
pros: Really to many to list,But a few, 1. great people 2. Great Benefits 3. great hours 4. This Hospital is a state of the art and Beyond to work for,I have never seen a Hospital so far in advance in Technology. 5.awesome Team wor and More.

job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros:
I worked in the ER- loved everyone I worked with (for the most part). Northside does a great job with hiring and the management was very cool and easy to talk to. Never had any issues! 
For being in a stressful ER environment it really was nice to have fun and laugh with my coworkers. Even the nurses on the other floors were great. I would go back to Northside in a heartbeat (I changed industries)
cons: You basically get the tiniest incremental percentage raise each year

pros: Northside did a great job caring for employees during the COVID-19 pandemic in terms of maintaining benefits and avoiding layoffs or pay cuts. It is a hospital system that demonstrates value for its patients and continuously strives for excellence.

I enjoy the creative freedom and independence in my role and feel very supported. Employees are valued here and given opportunities to grow and develop.

pros: Feels like family. Lots of support from co-workers and management. Challenging but have what I need to do a very job. Opportunity to grow and move up. Great learning environment.

pros: Northside Hospital offers opportunities to grow in an organization that is mindful of not only the patient experience (highest priority), but also the employee's experience. I feel blessed to be a part of Northside Hospital!
cons: I am looking forward to growth in the area of charting systems and streamlined communications with providers at Northside.

pros: Great benefits package and they are one of the very few company's that still offer a pension plan. I get to help people everyday that has received a diagnosis that I'm pretty sure they would have rather not. I am so thankful to be able to help!
cons: I don't have any cons. Plus I like to focus on the positives and if there is a negative I'd rather figure out a way to turn it into a positive.

pros: I have been working for Northside Hospital 5yrs and I have enjoyed every bit of it. The company has great benefits, strives to give the best customer service across the board.  Always encouraging employees to volunteer in the community or giving donations to different corporations and departments to help others.  It really makes me smile knowing I work for a company that no matter what is going on we still strive to do the same and help others.
cons: None at this present time

pros: Good Unit Culture, supportive management, flexible scheduling and reasonably competitive pay. My co-workers love their jobs and it shows, helps keep morale up even during tough times.

Northside did hire a lot of travel nurses to support COVID staffing, when if they would have offered more incentive to staff, there wouldn’t have been so much attrition.

review_title: If you are in the right click , you can go far!!

Job opportunities are according to if you are in the right click!! Doing a great job does not guarantee you consideration for full-time or advancement.
